courses.title: Python Level 1, May Half Term Mini-Camp (28th May - 31st May 2024) - AM
courses.description: Embark on your programming journey with our comprehensive Python Level 1 course, perfect for beginners. This course introduces you to Python, covering the essentials from setting up your environment to writing your first script. You'll dive into core topics such as handling user input, understanding data types, and utilizing conditionals to make decisions in your code. Explore the power of loops with for, while, and nested loops, enabling you to handle repetitive tasks efficiently. You'll also learn to work with lists, dictionaries, and tuples, mastering common operations and understanding their applications. By the end of the course, you'll be proficient in writing functions, creating reusable and modular code, and ready to tackle more advanced Python programming challenges. Join us to build a solid foundation in Python and start coding confidently!
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Python Level 2, Summer Camp (12th June - 16th June 2024) - PM
courses.description: Our Python Level 2 course builds upon foundational skills with a focus on advanced concepts and practical applications. Students will explore a variety of libraries such as time, random, and turtle, learning to implement real-time functionalities, graphical shapes, and interactive games. They'll deepen their understanding of conditional statements through advanced projects and tackle error handling with try and except blocks. The course introduces students to APIs for fetching and using real-world data, and covers essential skills such as generating PDF files, QR codes, and working with fundamental data structures like stacks and queues. With a focus on GUI development using Tkinter, students will create engaging applications including games and utility tools like a GUI calculator. By the end of Python Level 2, students will have expanded their programming repertoire, equipped with the skills to develop more complex projects and solve real-world problems with Python.
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of Python required. Ideal for students who have completed Python Level 1.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Python Level 3, Autumn Term (1st October - 5th October 2024) - AM
courses.description: Python Level 3 is designed to elevate students' programming skills with a focus on advanced concepts and object-oriented programming (OOP). Students will delve into functional programming using lambda functions, map, filter, and reduce functions, enhancing their ability to process data efficiently. They'll also learn to utilize regular expressions for tasks such as password validation and text manipulation. The course emphasizes the transition to OOP, covering foundational concepts like classes, objects, attributes, and methods. Students will explore the benefits of OOP over procedural programming through hands-on projects like building a Tic Tac Toe game using Tkinter. They'll gain proficiency in defining classes, creating objects, and understanding the distinction between class attributes and instance attributes. Advanced topics include constructors (__init__ method), destructors (__del__ method), inheritance, and polymorphism, essential for developing scalable and modular applications. By the end of Python Level 3, students will have a solid grasp of OOP principles and be capable of designing and implementing complex projects using Python and Tkinter.
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: Advanced understanding of Python required. Ideal for students who have completed Python Level 2.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Scratch Beginner, May Half Term Mini-Camp (28th May - 31st May 2024) - AM
courses.description: Our Scratch Level 1 course introduces young learners to the basics of programming through fun and interactive activities. Starting with simple tasks, students learn what programming is and how to make the Scratch cat perform basic actions. They will become familiar with different blocks and movements, gradually building their confidence in coding. The course also covers sound and looks blocks, allowing students to enhance their projects with audio effects and visual changes. As the course progresses, students will explore essential programming concepts such as animations, loops, and conditional statements. They'll learn to use variables to keep track of scores and understand the principles of broadcasting and receiving messages. By the end of the course, students will have a solid foundation in Scratch programming, enabling them to create their own interactive projects and games. Join us to embark on a fun-filled coding adventure with Scratch!
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Scratch Intermediate, Summer Camp (12th June - 16th June 2024) - PM
courses.description: Building on the fundamentals from Scratch Level 1, our Scratch Level 2 course expands both the concepts and functionality of student projects. Learners will delve into more advanced motion and control blocks, custom blocks for modular coding, and lists for managing collections of data. This course encourages the creation of dynamic and interactive projects, with increased complexity and more sophisticated game mechanics. Students will also explore cloning to create multiple sprite instances, advanced variables for enhanced data handling, and complex conditional statements for refined decision-making. The introduction of event handling techniques will enable students to develop more interactive and responsive programs. By the end of Scratch Level 2, students will be proficient in creating multi-faceted projects with intricate animations, improved interactivity, and refined logic. Join us to elevate your Scratch skills and bring more ambitious ideas to life!
courses.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of Python required. Ideal for students who have completed Scratch Beginner.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG

courses.title: Scratch Advanced, Autumn Term (1st October - 5th October 2024) - PM
courses.description: Scratch Level 3 takes programming to new heights by focusing on both advanced concepts and enhanced functionality. Students will build on their existing knowledge to create complex, multi-level games with sophisticated features. The course covers advanced topics such as physics simulations, integrating external data, and implementing recursive functions and algorithms. Emphasis is placed on designing interactive, multi-sprite environments with more detailed animations and behaviors. In this level, students will also tackle collaborative projects, learning to work in teams to share and develop their creations. They will refine their debugging and optimization skills to ensure their projects run smoothly. By the end of Scratch Level 3, students will be adept at handling complex programming challenges, capable of creating highly interactive and polished projects. Join us to master advanced Scratch programming and bring your most creative and intricate ideas to life!
what_you_need: A laptop (Windows, Mac or Chromebook) with Python installed
courses.prior_knowledge: Advanced understanding of Scratch required. Ideal for students who have completed Scratch Intermediate.
courses.address: Blackheath High Senior School, Vanbrugh Park, London SE3 7AG
